title: Atlas 10
content: GFW aims to radically improve the availability, quality, and accessibility of forest data for everyone:  Governments can use GFW to detect illegal forest clearing and target forest law enforcement efforts.  Companies can monitor the impacts of commodity supply chains on forests and demonstrate compliance with sustainability commitments and certifications. Learn more at GFW Commodities.  NGOs & civil society can identify deforestation hotspots and bolster their investigations, advocacy, and campaigns.  Indigenous communities can monitor their territories and raise an alarm when their customary forests are threatened.  Media can gather evidence, data, and graphics for reporting.  Researchers can analyze forest trends on a local or global scale and better understand the causes of forest change.  Concerned citizens everywhere can learn more about the state of forests and participate in forest monitoring. Students and educators can learn more about forests at local and global scales.

title: Develop your own App
content: Develop your own App	  Do you ever wish that Global Forest Watch could be customized for your geography or issue of interest? Do you have a great idea for how GFW data could help solve a specific problem? Using GFW’s public Application Programming Interface (API) and open source code, anyone can build on GFW data and technology to create customized web-based or mobile applications. This section contains the tools and information you need to develop applications that harness Global Forest Watch data and technology.

Compelling data				Choose from dozens of data layers curated by Global Forest Watch - or upload your own.														Powerful analysis				Run advanced statistical and geospatial analyses, right in the browser.														Proven platform				My Forest Atlas is built on ESRI’s easy-to-use ArcGIS Online mapping platform.														Broad reach				Share your maps with integrated social media tools, or add it to the forest atlas gallery.														Build your own Atlas			Follow these simple steps to get up and running in minutes. Mauris at laoreet enim, at luctus nisi. Vestibulum at orci et sem scelerisque prottitor. Interger fringilla ultrices congue. Nam at sodales sapien.											1				Watch the tutorial videos				These step-by-step guides will teach you how to set up an ArcGIS Online user acount, produce a basic interactive map, and share your custom forest atlas.										2				Create a map				Add data layers to the map canvas, and stylize them appropriately. All of your progress will be saved to your account, so you can work at your own pace.										3				Share your forest atlas				Use integrated social media tools to share interactive forest atlas with your networks, export the map as a static image, or submit it into the forest atlas gallery.
